conversations.value:
Given a submodules interconnection graph: 
<graph>
, 
nodes: [{'id': 0, 'content': 'A', 'type': 'input port'}, {'id': 1, 'content': 'B', 'type': 'input port'}, {'id': 2, 'content': 'S', 'type': 'output port'}, {'id': 3, 'content': 'C32', 'type': 'output port'}, {'id': 4, 'content': 'CLA1', 'type': 'submodule'}, {'id': 5, 'content': 'CLA2', 'type': 'submodule'}], 
edge_attrs: [], 
connectivity: [[1, 0, 4, 0, 1, 5, 4, 5, 4], [4, 4, 5, 5, 5, 2, 2, 3, 3]]
, Implement a module of a carry-lookahead 32-bit adder that uses the Carry-Lookahead Adder (CLA) architecture.

Module name:  
    adder_32bit               
Input ports:
    A[32:1]: 32-bit input operand A.
    B[32:1]: 32-bit input operand B.
Output ports:
    S[32:1]: 32-bit output representing the sum of A and B.
    C32: Carry-out output.

Implementation:
The top module adder_32bit consists of several instances of the 16 bit CLA block you design.

Give me the complete code.
module adder_32bit(A,B,S,C32);
